fairness_OR: The situation is fair because the algorithm has chosen an at-risk component of the machinery to be checked on which constitutes Chris' job in the factory. There are no further stipulations beyond the command to fix the machinery.
emotion_OR: Though the algorithm's role may seem to replace communication between the manager and worker, I don't think it is at the level to cause anger, disappointment or frustration. In addition, Chris is completing meaningful work to upkeep the factory and so though I wouldn't say he's joyful or proud, there probably is some happiness as this is his job and one would hope he is enjoying his chosen career.
trust_OR: Joined by the watchful eye of the manager, I think there is a lot of trust put into the algorithm especially in the fact that it seems to be continuously updated in regards to the various factors at hand, which is important to properly analyze the factory's well-being. The algorithm is at the heart of the factory's well-being.
algorithm definition: Algorithms are a set of rules to be followed in calculations

MC Human OR: The manage evaluated some of his work and the algorithm made a final decision
fairness_OR: I feel neutral
emotion_OR: I think his feelings may be neutral
trust_OR: I feel neutral

fairness_OR: Well, since it's the manager's job to make the schedule, and he feels Chris is better suited for morning shifts, then it is fair.
emotion_OR: I don't think Chris minds working morning shifts. It gives him afternoons and evenings off.
trust_OR: I think his decisions are fair.

MC Human OR: An algorithm and a manager analyze the importance of components in the factory and how they have worn and broken down in the past. The algorithm analyzes this data and makes a final decision on who gets assigned what maintenance work.
fairness_OR: I think as long as the manager's analysis is part of the decision that this is fair. The algorithm can be okay for the most part, but I think an actual human is going to know better what Chris can do and can't do.
emotion_OR: I think he'll be fine with it and do the job that he has been hired to do. I don't perceive him having any negative feelings.
trust_OR: The main component of this is the manager's analyses going into the equation. I would expect a lot of emphasis in the algorithm being placed on this component. The algorithm also knows what needs to be done.
algorithm definition: The algorithms are computer programs that are used to monitor and analyze the different systems.

fairness_OR: The manager took into consideration when employees are available to work and that is fair.

MC Human OR: The manager monitors the algorithm to determine which components need to be repaired and assigns a technician to fix it.
fairness_OR: The algorithm helps Chris do his job more effectively.
emotion_OR: Chris might be slightly frustrated to have to wait for an assignment from the manager. He can possibly monitor the algorithm on his own without waiting for orders from another person.
trust_OR: The algorithm gives the manager information on component wear that they otherwise would not have.
algorithm definition: A computer program that processes information to make a decision or aid in decision making.

MC Human OR: The algorithm computed risk of mechanical need, and the manager dictated actions based on that need.
fairness_OR: preemptive repair can keep things running smoothly instead of creating long delays. As an employee, I am assuming that repairs may fall under Chris's job description; my answer would be different if Chris's job description did not include anything about dealing with repairs and maintenance.
emotion_OR: I'm not sure why he would feel any of these things without further information; is Chris very busy with other important tasks? Is Chris a cafeteria worker that doesn't interact with this machinery at all? There's not enough information. If Chris is simply an employee, then when the manager directs him to perform some work, I'm not sure why he would particularly feel any of these emotions for a task that sounds pretty normal.
trust_OR: If the algorithmic analysis wasn't very good, then they should adjust it.
algorithm definition: A set of steps to complete a process

MC Human OR: The algorithm assisted the manager by providing analysis of employee availability and number of customers and the manager used that information to make decisions. The manager had the final say.
fairness_OR: The manager has the final decision regarding scheduling and the manager is familiar with Chris.
emotion_OR: Chris may agree with the scheduling and the algorithm just assists.
trust_OR: The manager's job is to run the coffee shop in an efficient way and use the tools at his or her disposal to do so. Using the tools available to improve efficiency is good management.
algorithm definition: Computer programs that gather data and analyze it and use that data to reach certain conclusions.

MC Human OR: The manager analyzes the employee's availability and the algorithm matches that with based on how many customers are expected at specific times during the day.
fairness_OR: It only makes sense that employees are scheduled according to when they are needed the most, which is during the most busiest times of the day. If Chris is available in the morning and more customers are expected in the morning then the algorithm would naturally schedule it that way.
emotion_OR: Chris is available to work in the morning so I am sure that he appreciates being given the work hours.
trust_OR: If the decision is made using a combination of both, then that is more efficient. If Chris is available, but not as skilled at his job, then the manager might think about scheduling someone else who is also available in the morning.
algorithm definition: Algorithms calculate results given a certain set of criteria. These are computer calculations based on the information being considered.

fairness_OR: The company has established this policy and if Chris is aware of the policy it is fair. The only problem I can see is that a computer is not a good substitute for a human manager.
emotion_OR: If the algorithm's evaluation indicates Chris has poor performance, he may become frustrated and angry at the results.
trust_OR: A computer is cannot make the same evaluations about human behavior as a human.
algorithm definition: Computer program that identifies patterns.

MC Human OR: The manager monitors the algorithm as it makes its choices. The algorithm will automatically sort through resumes and select those that match certain specifications.
fairness_OR: It is not selected on any personal bias but is automated.
emotion_OR: He may be expected an actual person to select his resume, but now he has to figure out how to get past the algorithm!
trust_OR: If it is being used already then it must be somewhat effective, but the automation loses the complete human touch when selecting candidates.
algorithm definition: Rules or processes that a computer follows while it completes actions.

fairness_OR: Fair because he is only selecting top applicants
emotion_OR: He would have postive emotions due to him wanting the job
trust_OR: He is only selecting the best so he is trustworthy.

fairness_OR: Chris has stated an availability in the mornings, so I feel it's fine. If he hadn't specified mornings, I'd feel that was unfair.

trust_OR: If it's working off of info provided from the employees as to their availability, then I somewhat trust it to make good schedules. However, I'm not sure how much it can take into account preferences for certain shifts regardless of overall availability.
algorithm definition: Processes that make decisions based upon input values.
